Special.origin: [ circumstances justifying an award of attorney's fees]

1.definition: distinguished by some unusual quality [ circumstances justifying an award of attorney's fees]

2.definition: relating to a single thing or class of thingshaving an individual character or trait [owed them a duty not owed to the public at large]

sub_terms.b: assigned or provided to meet a need not covered under established procedures

4.definition: designed or selected for a particular purpose, occasion, or other end [family courts are courts of limited and jurisdiction ", 559 P.2d 744 (1977)"]
